criterion: Reward for explicit documentation of the patient’s amlodipine adherence difficulty, including missed pharmacy pickups and inconsistent pill-organizer use
Reward for capturing and attributing the clinician’s adherence-improvement counseling (phone reminders, pill organizer strategies) as part of the note
Reward for recording patient-reported symptoms and pertinent negatives specific to amlodipine (absence of ankle/foot swelling, presence of fatigue) exactly as stated
Reward for documenting the clinician’s further evaluation of fatigue (questions about sleep quality or other recent changes) to demonstrate differential assessment
Reward for inclusion of the social determinant that the patient lives alone and how it contributes to medication non-adherence
Reward for accurately listing ongoing antihypertensive therapy (amlodipine 10 mg) with correct dose and without introducing unverified medications or allergies
Penalize for failure to document a safety plan or follow-up monitoring related to antihypertensive therapy (e.g., blood-pressure checks, surveillance for edema or persistent fatigue)
Penalize for redundant, copy-pasted, or extraneous information that is not new or case-specific to this encounter segment
